CASI MUERTO

Day of Defeat Classic es un videojuego basado en la 2da Guerra Mundial en donde dos bandos se enfrentan para capturar las banderas (o posiciones en el mapa). O al menos es el único modo que encontré en mi corta estadía en este juego. En todo el mundo no habrá más de 70 jugadores en línea y varios de los servidores los compartes con bots. Además que el ping para los latinos está como mínimo a 110. Lo cual lo hace un tanto fastidioso por el lag que notarás.

De los varios juegos clásicos de Valve, creo que este es uno de los que menos me gusta. Su diseño de nivel me parece un tanto confuso para principiantes. Tiene el peor mini mapa que he conocido jamás y el trabajo sonoro pudo ser mejor creo yo. Empero admiro la variedad de clases para cada tipo de jugador.

No dudo que haya sido un buen juego en su época, pero si lo quieres probar te invito a que juegues su versión Source (versión mejorada). Saludos!

I'd have over 10k hours sunk into this game. 

Probably not the best ww2 game, but my god have we had some good times together. It will forever be in my heart.

Понравилась

Day of Defeat was an attempt by Valve to branch out their multiplayer catalogue into the WW2 genre. Since there's no story we're jumping straight into graphics.

Graphics:

Of course since this was made on the first version of the source engine, graphics haven't stood the test of time. Textures are blurry, models are rather bland and environments are incredibly simplistic. It looks about on par with every other multiplayer game Valve have released at the time, so if you played at least one of the other games like Counter Strike you know what to expect.

Audio:

Audio design is fine for the most part. Soldiers will scream in the field after getting shot or warn their fellow soldiers of incoming grenades. Guns sound for the most part, even though the quality of the audio is a bit low quality. The audio design is somewhat charming in a way, especially if you grew up with these games, but they definitely don't sound amazing.

Gameplay:

Day of Defeat is designed much more on teamplay than the other Valve multiplayer games (apart from maybe Counter Strike). You join either the Allies or the Axis, pick your role with it's own specific weapons like snipers, bazookas or machine guns and try to take over points in the maps you're playing on.

Before continuing onward, I will state that the game is pretty much dead. Most servers are absolutely empty and you will have trouble finding any matches. However there are dedicated communities that still play this game religiously, but the problem is if you're anything, but an American you can forget about having stable ping in those servers. Enemies lag through walls and sometimes a dead body will just stand still making you think that they're alive, while another enemy lags into view and kills you.

Of course it does have some of the things that plagues most other classic Valve games. A lot of the times the hit detection could be a little bit iffy, but overall I feel like my shots would connect when they were spot on, but a few of my headshots would miss. Not to mention the aiming is a bit stiff, but it works fine once you get used to it, or have played a few of the other games like Team Fortress.

If you can get it to run at a decent ping, the game is fun and works fine and I would even go as far to say that it's one of the better classic multiplayer games Valve has put out (not as good as Counter Strike of course), but it's definitely really fun. When you do get plenty of people and large fire fights ensue it's actually quite fun, but sadly since I'm from Europe I can't enjoy it as much as I would like to.

Verdict:

As I said before, I feel like Day of Defeat is one of the better multiplayer games Valve have put out. I had a blast when I managed to get it to work, but sadly those moments we're not frequent. If you're from the US you can definitely join one of the frequent servers with people still playing to this day, but if you're from anywhere else, you might as well consider the game dead.

Final Rating:
5/10

Pros:
+ Fun team based gameplay
+ Tons of weapons to play around with

Cons:
- The only running servers are unplayable from anywhere, but the US
- Most servers are dead
- Hit detection does suck a bit

If you liked this review please consider following our groups and curator pages at https://steamcommunity.com/groups/completingthebacklog and https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ImperialReviews

If you peek an angle slightly wrong in this game, you die. If you miss a shot with a rifle, you die. If you pull out a grenade at the wrong time, you die. If you let an MG player set up, you die. If you let the enemy get a height advantage, you die. If you get nervous, or too bold, or complacent, you die.
Whoever called it "Day of Defeat" wasn't kidding.
...9/10.

[b] Oui c'est bien LE Day Of Defeat ! 
Le super jeu en ligne qui a résisté pendant.... 20 ans (!)  [/b]  
Pour mémoire, ce jeu militaire  est un shooter WW2 en ligne de génie. 
Il est simple et intuitif avec des dizaines de cartes d'opérations sur serveurs.

Pour fêter ses 20 ans, et surtout pour le plaisir de tous, n'hésitez pas à y initier toute la famille. C'est l'assurance pour tous de centaines d'heures de jeu passionné en ligne...
